org.numenta.nupic.network

Interface PersistenceAPI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Persistence.PersistenceAccess

    public interface PersistenceAPI
extends java.io.Serializable

    Offers 4 basic types of functionality:

    • Obtain an instance of the low-level serializer
    • Provide convenience methods for storing a Network
    • Provide a method to Check Point a Network (snapshot it to the local file system).
    • Provide generic methods to store any HTM object which is Persistable

    While the generic methods will work for the entire Network (since it is Persistable), there are convenience methods to store a Network specifically. These come in the form of "store" and "load" methods:

    • store(Network)
    • storeAndGet(Network)
    • load()
    • load(String)

    The more generic persistence methods are of the form "write" and "read" as in:

    • write(Persistable)
    • write(Persistable, String)
    • read(byte[])
    • read(String)

    To obtain an instance of the PersistanceAPI, simply call: 

     PersistenceAPI api = Persistence.get();

    Although the PersistenceAPI is adequate for the majority of cases, you may also obtain an instance of the underlying serializer (see SerializerCore) that the PersistenceAPI itself uses: 

     SerializerCore core = Persistence.get().serializer();
    The core serializer can be used to serialize to and from an Input/Output stream, or to and from byte arrays.

    Author:
    cogmission
    See Also:
    SerializerCore

    • Method Detail

      • serializer

        <T extends Persistable> SerializerCore serializer()
        Factory method to return a configured NetworkSerializer If the "returnNew" flag is true, this method returns a new instance of NetworkSerializer and stores it for subsequent invocations of this method. If false, the previously stored NetworkSerializer is returned.
        Parameters:
        config - the SerialConfig storing file storage parameters etc.
        returnNew - NetworkSerializers are expensive to instantiate so specify if the previous should be re-used or if you want a new one.
        Returns:
        a NetworkSerializer
        See Also:
        SerialConfig

      • load

        Network load()
        Convenience method to load a Network from the default or previously configured location and serial file, and returns it.
        Returns:
        the deserialized Network
        See Also:
        SerialConfig

      • load

        Network load(java.lang.String fileName)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method to load a Network from the specified serialized file name and returns it.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the serialization file.
        Returns:
        returns the specified Network
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        SerialConfig

      • store

        void store(Network network)
        Convenience method to store the specified Network to the pre-configured (with SerialConfig) location and filename.
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to store

      • storeAndGet

        <R> R storeAndGet(Network network)
        Stores the specified Network at the pre-configured location, after halting and shutting down the Network. To store the Network but keep it up and running, please see the #checkPointer() method. The Network, may however be #restart()ed after this method is called.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the returned object
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to persist
        returnBytes - flag indicating whether to return the interim byte array
        Returns:
        the serialized Network in the format is either a byte[] or String (json), where byte[] is the default of type <R>

      • checkPointer

        CheckPointOp<byte[]> checkPointer(Network network)
        Returns an rx.Observable operator that when subscribed to, invokes an operation that stores the state of this Network while keeping the Network up and running. The Network will be stored at the pre-configured location (in binary form only, not JSON).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the stored object
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to check point
        Returns:
        the CheckPointOp operator of type <T>

      • read

        <R extends Persistable> R read()
        Reifies a Persistable from the specified file in the location and file name configured by the SerialConfig passed in at construction time.
        Returns:
        the reified type <R>

      • read

        <R extends Persistable> R read(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reifies a Persistable from the specified file in the location configured by the SerialConfig passed in at construction time.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the returned serialized form
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file from which to get the serialized object.
        Returns:
        the reified type <R>

      • read

        <R extends Persistable> R read(byte[] serializedBytes)
        Loads a Persistable from the specified serialized byte array and returns the de-serialized Persistable.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the returned serialized form
        Parameters:
        serializedBytes - the name of the serialization file.
        Returns:
        the reified type <R>

      • write

        <T extends Persistable,R> R write(T instance)
        Persists the Persistable subclass to the file system using the pre-configured SerialConfig specified at the time this object was instantiated, or the default SerialConfig.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the stored object
        R - the type of the returned serialized form
        Parameters:
        instance - the subclass of Persistable to persist.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the serialized object of type <R>

      • write

        <T extends Persistable,R> R write(T instance,
                                  java.lang.String fileName)
        Persists the Persistable subclass to the file system using the pre-configured SerialConfig specified at the time this object was instantiated, or the default SerialConfig.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the stored object
        R - the type of the returned serialized form
        Parameters:
        instance - the subclass of Persistable to persist.
        fileName - the name of the file to which the object is stored.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the serialized object of type <R>

      • getPreviousCheckPoint

        java.lang.String getPreviousCheckPoint(java.lang.String checkPointFileName)
        Returns the checkpointed file previous to the specified file (older), or null if one doesn't exist. The file name may be the entire filename (as configured by the SerialConfig object which establishes both the filename portion and the date portion formatting), or just the date portion of the filename.
        Parameters:
        checkPointFileName - (can be entire name or just date portion)
        Returns:
        the full filename of the file checkpointed immediately previous to the file specified.

        Convenience method which returns the store file fully qualified path.
